GoalDescription: A society where the rule of law is consistently upheld, and access to timely justice is available to everyone
PolicyObjectiveDescription: Strengthen links between traditional and formal justice systems and the role of chiefs in maintaining peace and stability
IndicatorDescription: Incidents of theft and vandalism reported annually to the police (and the proportion of reported incidents to unreported)
ComputationMethod: 1.      incidents of theft and vandalism reported annually to the police. 2. Number of reported Incident divided by total number of report and unreported incident multiply by 100.
Concept: Police should respond to reports of theft, suspicious activity and vandalism.
DataSource:
* Well-being Indicators Baseline 2012 
* Department of Vanuatu Police  Office, Crime Unit,
* Department of Magistrate Court
Definition: Theft is the act of stealing – the wrongful taking of your personal goods and property to another location. Vandalism is deliberate mischievous or malicious destruction or damage to your goods and property.
Dissaggregation:
* reported incidents
 * unreported incidents
* Area Council Level
* Rural/Urban
* Provincial Level
* National Level
IndicatorShortName: Reported Incidents of Theft and Vandalism
Rationale: To identify the nature of theft and vandalism on residential building sites in terms of time, areas and types of items stolen, also to examine the extent of security measures adopted and identify areas for improvement to reduce opportunities for theft and vandalism on building sites.
source_organisation_1: 2012 Melanesian Well-being Indicators Pilot Study Report - VNSO
